fields.description:
Move platform security update that occurs on session start in Ignitia, to a background queue.

The security update can occur as the main screen is loading and this will help with the speed of the application.

We are focusing on handling bursts of messages as most people will log into the application around the same time of day.

fields.description:
With Havas moving to SaaS, we only need to support Prisma Platform Security and no longer need to support on-premise Federated Security

*Current State*

We currently support both Prisma Platform Security and Federated Security Integrations. This includes syncing user details such as authorisations and client/division access from both Platform Security and Enterprise. 

*Desired State*

Only support syncing user details from Prisma platform security

fields.description:
The current Ignitia application is one large web application.

We would like to have a collection of separate web applications for pricing features:

* A web application to handle the web pages in Ignitia with pricing related data
* A web application for cost refresh (Prisma integration)
* A web application for financial update and other parts of the Prisma integration

This web application is for the web pages that let the user configure pricing related data.

fields.description:
The security code in Ignitia is not in one place and cannot be shared across multiple web applications.

To make the security reusable across the web applications it will be easier if it did not use the common data layer in Ignitia.

This epic will deliver a library so that multiple web applications can use one library to provide security to all Ignitia code that will be spread across multiple web applications.

* Run Ignitia code in a web application

This epic will achieve the outcome of being able to:

* Split Ignitia code into multiple web applications easily

fields.description:
Audit tables are required to:
 * track the before and after values of changed data (added, modified and deleted)
 * who performed the change
 * Date/Time of when the change was made

 

All tables must contain an audit trail.

 

*Current state*

As changes are made to the database schema, additional work is required by the developer to ensure that new tables / fields are also captured within the corresponding Audit table.

This includes:
 * Changes applied to the main transaction table
 * Corresponding changes to the Audit table
 * Database changes applied to the triggers that are used to populate Audit tables

It has been found that Audit tables were not updated when changes were made to the transactional tables, meaning auditing was not done when Users update data.

*Preferred state*

When deploying Ignitia, we can either:
 * Fail the deployment, if any of the transactional / audit tables are out of sync; or
 * automate the process of creating / updating audit tables

issuetype.name: Epic

fields.description:
h3. Current state

-1.5 millions records in the contract system is taking 3.5 minutes per period of each placement to calculate. The booking screen inside Ignitia also takes 3.5 minutes to find the correct service fee, rebate. This is just for the billable costs - not including the payable side.- [Rob to discuss with Rich to get some realistic numbers here for OMG go live]

Cost refresh for Prisma is susceptible to performance issues as it is currently running on shared infrastructure with the Ignitia product (shared database).

For cost refresh a thread is created per booking making the solution susceptible to high I/O and CPU.  e.g. 1 concurrent user with a Cost Refresh of 1000 bookings = 1000 threads, 50 concurrent users with a cost refresh of 1000 bookings = 50,000 threads.
h3. Desired state

Cost Refresh Performance better than what we now with Prisma campaigns with  1, 100, 500, and 1000 placements.  
 * 1000 placements within 2 seconds

Cost refresh in a position to be isolated hardware away from the Ignitia product so that availability can be guaranteed for Prisma to function correctly.

 

Detailed Objectives as per confluence page  [https://confluence.mediaocean.com/display/GBP/Cost+Refresh+refactoring]

fields.summary: Performance Improvement of Cost Refresh API

fields.description:
h3. Epic description 

As an approver, I want to receive an email notification when an invoice is ready for my approval, so that I don't need to go to Ignitia home page and check.

In order to facilitate the client invoice approval process, there should be email notifications in place that would allow approvers approve invoices via the URL in the email.

This will help with the communication, especially for managers who don't use Ignitia on a regular basis.
h3. *Business outcome*
 * Email notifications of what's ready for approval and what's been approved

h3. *User persona*

_Approver (roles may vary)_ - would want to receive an email notification that invoices are ready for approval.

_AR clerk_ - would want to receive an email notification that invoices have been approved.
h3. Epic/Issue background

All invoices ready for approval appear on the Ignitia home page, however, this may not be sufficient for users who don't user Ignitia on a daily bases.

In this case, it needs to be communicated separately outside Ignitia that invoices are ready for approval. 

Email notifications will speed up the approval process and allow AR clerk to send invoices to clients sooner.
